intro: Eliea articulata subsp. brevistyla, commonly known as the narrow-styled eliea, is a flowering plant species native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Meliaceae, which includes mahogany and related trees. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers with distinct sepals and petals. Its leaves are typically opposite and ovate, with a smooth or slightly hairy surface. The subspecies is distinguished by its shorter styles compared to other members of the species.
